etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, "word; speech") + 射(射) (shè, "shoot") = expression of words -> thank; apologize
etymology.interpretation: The character 谢(謝) (xiè, "thank; apologize") combines 言(言) (yán, "word; speech") to represent communication and 射(射) (shè, "shoot") for its phonetic properties. This suggests the use of speech in a directed, intentional way to convey gratitude or apology.
etymology.simplification: Simplification involved replacing 言(言) (yán, "word; speech") with the simpler 讠(讠) (yán, "word; speech") radical for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 谢谢你的帮助(謝謝你的幫助)。
我必须道谢(我必須道謝)，并向你道歉(並向你道歉)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bìxū dào xiè, bìng xiàng nǐ dào qiàn.
examples.english: I must thank you and apologize to you.

examples.chinese: 秋风起时(秋風起時)，花谢了(花謝了)。
examples.english: When the autumn wind rises, the flowers wither.
